title: Propulsion Assignment
description:
The assignment is available online.

Design and analyze a comprehensive rocket propulsion system for a Mars mission.

Your submission should include the following:
• Detailed thrust calculations and performance analysis
• Fuel efficiency calculations and optimization strategies
• Propellant selection with justification
• Engine design specifications and schematics
• Safety considerations and failure modes analysis
• Performance graphs and simulation results

Submit your report as a PDF along with any MATLAB or Python code used for calculations.

title: Combustion Analysis
description:
The assignment is available online.

Conduct a detailed combustion analysis for rocket propulsion systems.

Your analysis must include:
• Chemical reaction kinetics and equilibrium calculations
• Temperature and pressure profiles in the combustion chamber
• Heat transfer analysis
• Combustion efficiency calculations
• Comparison of different fuel-oxidizer combinations
• Environmental impact assessment

Provide detailed calculations, graphs, and a written report explaining your methodology and findings.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description:
The assignment is available online.

Design an optimal rocket nozzle for maximum thrust efficiency.

Your project deliverables should include:
• Nozzle geometry calculations (throat area, expansion ratio, exit area)
• Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) analysis
• Pressure and velocity distribution plots
• Thrust vectoring mechanism design (if applicable)
• Material selection with thermal considerations
• Manufacturing feasibility assessment
• 3D CAD model of the nozzle design

Submit technical drawings, CFD results, and a comprehensive design report.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description:
The quiz is available online.

Complete a comprehensive assessment covering fundamental aerodynamics principles.

Topics covered include:
• Fluid dynamics equations and Bernoulli's principle
• Lift and drag force calculations
• Boundary layer theory and flow separation
• Compressible flow and shock waves
• Supersonic and hypersonic aerodynamics
• Wind tunnel testing methodologies

The quiz consists of 25 multiple choice questions and 5 calculation problems. You will have 90 minutes to complete it.

title: Flow Analysis
description:
The assignment is available online.

Perform computational fluid dynamics analysis on spacecraft surfaces during atmospheric entry.

Your deliverables should include:
• CFD simulation setup and methodology
• Flow field visualization and analysis
• Pressure distribution on vehicle surfaces
• Velocity profiles and streamline patterns
• Mach number contours for supersonic regions
• Comparison with analytical solutions
• Recommendations for vehicle design optimization

Submit simulation files, visualization images, and a detailed technical report.

title: Heating Analysis
description:
The assignment is available online.

Calculate and analyze aerodynamic heating effects during spacecraft re-entry.

Your analysis must cover:
• Heat flux calculations at various altitudes
• Temperature distribution on spacecraft surfaces
• Thermal protection system (TPS) design requirements
• Material selection for heat shields
• Ablation analysis and erosion rates
• Cooling system requirements
• Trade-off analysis for different TPS configurations

Provide detailed calculations, thermal simulation results, and design recommendations.

title: Structural Design Task
description:
The assignment is available online.

Design spacecraft structural components considering mechanical loads and material properties.

Your design package should include:
• Structural load analysis (static and dynamic)
• Stress and strain calculations using FEA
• Material selection with property justification
• Factor of safety calculations
• Fatigue life analysis
• Vibration analysis for launch loads
• Weight optimization strategies
• Detailed engineering drawings

Submit FEA results, calculations, CAD models, and a comprehensive design report.

title: Orbital Calculations
description:
The assignment is available online.

Calculate orbital mechanics for a satellite mission from Earth to Mars.

Your submission should include:
• Orbital element calculations (semi-major axis, eccentricity, inclination)
• Hohmann transfer orbit design
• Delta-v budget for entire mission
• Launch window analysis
• Trajectory optimization
• Gravitational assist calculations (if applicable)
• Mission timeline and key events

Provide detailed calculations, MATLAB/Python scripts, trajectory plots, and a mission analysis report.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description:
The exam is available online.

Comprehensive examination covering spacecraft systems engineering principles.

Exam topics include:
• Systems integration and interface management
• Requirements analysis and verification
• Trade study methodologies
• Risk management and mitigation strategies
• Project management and scheduling
• Configuration management
• Quality assurance processes
• Life cycle cost analysis

The exam consists of 30 multiple choice questions, 10 short answer questions, and 2 design problems. You will have 3 hours to complete it.
